results.title: A phase II clinical trial of the Safety Of Simvastatin (SOS) in patients with pulmonary lymphangioleiomyomatosis and with tuberous sclerosis complex.
results.text_hl: A phase II clinical trial of the Safety Of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ (SOS) in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Lymphangioleiomyomatosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018192 @@@pulmonary lymphangioleiomyomatosis@@@ and with @DISEASE_Tuberous_Sclerosis @DISEASE_MESH:D014402 @@@tuberous sclerosis complex@@@.

results.title: Management of lymphangioleiomyomatosis
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ was also shown to reduce alveolar space enlargement in a @SPECIES_10090 @@@mouse@@@ model of @<m>DISEASE_Lymphangioleiomyomatosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018192 @@@LAM@@@.

citations.NLM: Taveira-DaSilva AM, Moss J. Management of lymphangioleiomyomatosis F1000Prime Rep. 2014;6():116. PMID: 25580270

results.title: Prevention of alveolar destruction and airspace enlargement in a mouse model of pulmonary lymphangioleiomyomatosis (LAM).
results.text_hl: Our findings demonstrate a mechanistic link between loss of @GENE_TSC2 @GENE_22084 @@@TSC2@@@ and @DISEASE_Liver_Cirrhosis_Biliary @DISEASE_MESH:D008105 @@@alveolar destruction@@@ and suggest that treatment with @CHEMICAL_Sirolimus @CHEMICAL_MESH:D020123 @@@rapamycin@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ together could benefit @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Lymphangioleiomyomatosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018192 @@@LAM@@@ by targeting cells with @GENE_TSC2 @GENE_7249 @@@TSC2@@@ dysfunction and preventing airspace enlargement.

citations.NLM: Goncharova EA, Goncharov DA, Fehrenbach M, Khavin I, Ducka B, Hino O, Colby TV, Merrilees MJ, Haczku A, Albelda SM, Krymskaya VP. Prevention of alveolar destruction and airspace enlargement in a mouse model of pulmonary lymphangioleiomyomatosis (LAM). Sci Transl Med. 2012 Oct 3;4(154):154ra134. PMID: 23035046

results.title: Retrospective review of combined sirolimus and simvastatin therapy in lymphangioleiomyomatosis.
results.text_hl: Retrospective review of combined @CHEMICAL_Sirolimus @CHEMICAL_MESH:D020123 @@@sirolimus@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ therapy in @<m>DISEASE_Lymphangioleiomyomatosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018192 @@@lymphangioleiomyomatosis@@@.

results.title: Lymphangioleiomyomatosis: New Treatment Perspectives.
results.text_hl: The article discussed the new control studies with mTOR inhibitors, @CHEMICAL_Doxycycline @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004318 @@@doxycycline@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, and combination of them in @<m>DISEASE_Lymphangioleiomyomatosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018192 @@@LAM@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@.

results.title: Statins in lymphangioleiomyomatosis. Simvastatin and atorvastatin induce differential effects on tuberous sclerosis complex 2-null cell growth and signaling.
results.journal: Am J Respir Cell Mol Biol
results.text_hl: These findings have translational significance for combinatorial therapeutic strategies of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ to inhibit @GENE_TSC2 @GENE_7249 @@@TSC2@@@-null cell survival in @DISEASE_Tuberous_Sclerosis @DISEASE_MESH:D014402 @@@TS@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Lymphangioleiomyomatosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018192 @@@LAM@@@.
